Subject: Computer Forensics - Budget Estimate 
Date: Tue, 23 Jun 2020 20:29:21 +0000 
Inline-Images: Unage001.png; image002.png 
To follow up on our conversation late last week, here is an estimate that covers the scope of work that we discussed. 
Here is what I would suggest as a statement of work: 
Specific deliverables known at this time include receiving, inventorying and forensically processing approximately 57 
devices (a mix of computer hard drives, mobile devices, and portable media); extracting and parsing relevant data from 
those devices (parsing may involve, for example, review of backups, compressed files or other data that is not initially 
categorized by forensic tools); creating Relativity load files; preparing summaries and analyses of the data; and briefing 
the investigative team on the contractor's findings. 
As to staffing the engagement, I would propose having two junior-level staff members conduct the review, to be 
supervised and assisted as necessary by a senior staff member (a former FBI computer scientist). A managing director 
would have overall responsibility for the project and would coordinate with SDNY. 
As to timing: we are available to start work immediately. Estimated time to complete the engagement would be 30 days 
(or less). 
As to a  budget, I would estimate between $85,000 to $135,000 as follows:

In addition to the foregoing hourly fees, we charge $200 per blank hard drive and $45 per blank thumb drive, to the 
extent they are required; as well as a fixed fee of $500 per device image (basically an equipment and software recovery 
fee for the specialized tools we use for forensics). 
Thank you again for considering us for this important matter. 
Please let me know if you have any questions. 
Best regards,
